alert.note: Alert for Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 06 at 1:43PM CST until March 07 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois, including the following areas, Randolph IL and Washington IL. Portions of southeast Missouri, including the following areas, Iron MO, Madison MO, Reynolds MO, Saint Francois MO and Sainte Genevieve MO. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected tonight, particularly this evening. Rainfall amounts in excess of 2 inches are expected, particularly across far southeast Missouri and southwest Illinois. This heavy rain may cause flash flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to your favorite source of weather information for updates and possible flash flood warnings. People in flood prone areas should be prepared to move to higher ground. Never drive into flood waters! Turn around, don`t drown!
